an10.76:6.3.pli: Ariyānaṁ adassanakamyataṁ appahāya, ariyadhammassa asotukamyataṁ appahāya, upārambhacittataṁ appahāya—
an10.76:6.3.en: Not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.

an10.76:7.1.pli: Tayome, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo ariyānaṁ adassanakamyataṁ pahātuṁ ariyadhammassa asotukamyataṁ pahātuṁ upārambhacittataṁ pahātuṁ.
an10.76:7.1.en: Without giving up three things you can’t give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.

an10.76:7.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo dhamme appahāya abhabbo ariyānaṁ adassanakamyataṁ pahātuṁ ariyadhammassa asotukamyataṁ pahātuṁ upārambhacittataṁ pahātuṁ.
an10.76:7.4.en: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.

an10.76:11.5.pli: So dussīlo samāno abhabbo ariyānaṁ adassanakamyataṁ pahātuṁ ariyadhammassa asotukamyataṁ pahātuṁ upārambhacittataṁ pahātuṁ.
an10.76:11.5.en: When you’re unethical you can’t give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.

an10.76:11.6.pli: So upārambhacitto samāno abhabbo muṭṭhassaccaṁ pahātuṁ asampajaññaṁ pahātuṁ cetaso vikkhepaṁ pahātuṁ.
an10.76:11.6.en: When you’ve got a fault-finding mind you can’t give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a scattered mind.

an10.76:16.3.pli: Ariyānaṁ adassanakamyataṁ pahāya, ariyadhammassa asotukamyataṁ pahāya, upārambhacittataṁ pahāya—
an10.76:16.3.en: Not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.

an10.76:17.1.pli: Tayome, bhikkhave, dhamme pahāya bhabbo ariyānaṁ adassanakamyataṁ pahātuṁ ariyadhammassa asotukamyataṁ pahātuṁ upārambhacittataṁ pahātuṁ.
an10.76:17.1.en: After giving up three things you can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.

an10.76:17.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo dhamme pahāya bhabbo ariyānaṁ adassanakamyataṁ pahātuṁ ariyadhammassa asotukamyataṁ pahātuṁ upārambhacittataṁ pahātuṁ.
an10.76:17.4.en: After giving up these three things you can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.

an10.76:21.5.pli: So sīlavā samāno bhabbo ariyānaṁ adassanakamyataṁ pahātuṁ ariyadhammassa asotukamyataṁ pahātuṁ upārambhacittataṁ pahātuṁ.
an10.76:21.5.en: When you’re ethical you can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.

an10.76:21.6.pli: So anupārambhacitto samāno bhabbo muṭṭhassaccaṁ pahātuṁ asampajaññaṁ pahātuṁ cetaso vikkhepaṁ pahātuṁ.
an10.76:21.6.en: When you don’t have a fault-finding mind you can give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a scattered mind.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.76
8. If You Want
Three Things

Verses of the Senior Monks 5.10
The Book of the Fives
Chapter One
Yasadatta

an7.29:1.7.pli: bhikkhūsu theresu ceva navesu ca majjhimesu ca upārambhacitto dhammaṁ suṇāti randhagavesī,
an7.29:1.7.en: They listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind.

an7.29:2.7.pli: bhikkhūsu theresu ceva navesu ca majjhimesu ca anupārambhacitto dhammaṁ suṇāti na randhagavesī,
an7.29:2.7.en: They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 7.29
3. The Vajji Seven
Non-decline for a Lay Follower

an7.31:1.8.pli: bhikkhūsu theresu ceva navesu ca majjhimesu ca anupārambhacitto dhammaṁ suṇāti na randhagavesī,
an7.31:1.8.en: They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 7.31
3. The Vajji Seven
Downfalls for a Lay Follower

an5.153:1.3.pli: Makkhī dhammaṁ suṇāti makkhapariyuṭṭhito, upārambhacitto dhammaṁ suṇāti randhagavesī, dhammadesake āhatacitto hoti khīlajāto, duppañño hoti jaḷo eḷamūgo, anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
an5.153:1.3.en: They listen to the teaching bent only on putting it down. They listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They’re antagonistic to the teacher, planning to attack them. They’re witless, dull, and idiotic. And they think they know what they don’t know.

an5.153:2.3.pli: Amakkhī dhammaṁ suṇāti na makkhapariyuṭṭhito, anupārambhacitto dhammaṁ suṇāti na randhagavesī, dhammadesake anāhatacitto hoti akhīlajāto, paññavā hoti ajaḷo aneḷamūgo, na anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
an5.153:2.3.en: They don’t listen to the teaching bent only on putting it down. They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They’re not antagonistic to the teacher, and not planning to attack them. They’re wise, bright, and clever. And they don’t think they know what they don’t know.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5.153
16. The True Teaching
Surety in the Right Way (3rd)
